data.title: Just tried this pizza chain on Saturday night.
data.text: Winter - hrummmph! Just too cold to venture out to a restaurant on Saturday night so we decided to take advantage of the half price - order online - promotion. Signed up with our local (six blocks away) Domino's and picked a delivery time and voila - the doorbell rang at exactly the appointed time. There were a few crust options - we chose hand tossed - and sauce options - we went with regular - and lots of topping choices. Sadly anchovies were not an option, but all the usual suspects were there. We ordered a 16" with the regular amount of normal pizza cheese. Never having eaten a Domino's Pizza before we went with the basics for our first try. The pizza arrived piping hot and was really very tasty. The dough was just right - a little puffy around the edges with just the right chew and crispness. We both felt there was a little more sauce and cheese than we prefer but that's just our preference and not a criticism. Over all we enjoyed it very much and loved the convenience of a quick online order delivered to our door on time and hot. Nice job Domino's! Oh, and the delivery guy was extremely polite!!

data.title: Domino's Pizza in Millville is better.
data.text: They lack the attention to the detail and their wings are dry and bony covered in slimy sauce. I think they are not concerned enough with their quality of work. They need to try a bit better and they can succeed like the entire successful franchise.

data.title: Absolutely Awful
data.text: Pizza crust was slathered in garlic. It was actually sickening. Bottom was overdone. 8 wings which were supposed to be hot, were regular flavor. They were rubbery,  like they were fresh out of the MICROWAVE! Dry, small, primarily bone, little meat. Out of 8 the dog ate 6. Emailed customer service -received a call, they sent a Free certificate for 1 LG 1 topping & 8 wings. We'll use it at Another location.
